chapter.title: Registering the redBorder Enterprise Edition IPS

section.title: Registering the IDS Sensor in the Manager
section.para: Now you are going to register the sensor, configured previously, in the Manager. To do this, you must go to the main menu and select option 1 - System configuration:

textobject.phrase: Figure 1: Registering the IDS Sensor in the Manager

caption.para: Figure 1: Registering the IDS Sensor in the Manager

section.para: Option 1 allows us to create a host name for the IDS/IPS sensor.
Option 2 allows us to indicate the local time of the IDS/IPS sensor.
In option 3 you must insert the domain or IP that the Manager has in its management interface.

textobject.phrase: Figure 2: Registering the IDS Sensor in the Manager

caption.para: Figure 2: Registering the IDS Sensor in the Manager

section.para: Lastly, you must select option 4 Register rB Sensor/ manager. This wizard will ask us for the username and password to access the web interface of the Manager (by default, the username is admin and the password is redborder).

textobject.phrase: Figure 3: Registering the IDS Sensor in the Manager

caption.para: Figure 3: Registering the IDS Sensor in the Manager

section.para: If you have followed these instructions, the sensor will be registered:

textobject.phrase: Figure 4: Registering the IDS Sensor in the Manager

caption.para: Figure 4: Registering the IDS Sensor in the Manager

section.para: Likewise, it will appear in the web interface of our Manager as configured. To verify this, you can access Sensors in the web interface to see if the last check in was satisfactory:

textobject.phrase: Figure 5: Registering the IDS Sensor in the Manager

caption.para: Figure 5: Registering the IDS Sensor in the Manager
